Description: Ostracon (?), section of the rim and body of a red pottery bowl with sharply convex sides and everted rim, the fabric is pink and grey in section, the outer surface is covered with a red-brown slip, the interior is covered in parts with a granular white deposit, the inside of the rim is painted white with three dark circles, there are remains of three incised Coptic letters on the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394321) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394321)
